SharpMermaid
Table of Contents

Create File

  • Create new file:
    If no file, with a specified FileName and FileType exists at OutputDirectory,
    the system must create a new file with the specified FileName and FileType at OutputDirectory
    see: scenario
    and the console must confirm the creation
    see: <xref:cross-features.create-file-acceptance-test>

  • Override file:
    If a file with the same FileName and FileType already exists at OutputDirectory,
    the system must overwrite it
    see: scenario
    and the console must display:
    "Overwriting existing file at '{OutputDirectory}/{FileName}{FileType}"
    see: scenario

  • Missing FileName:
    If FileName is not provided, the system must stop execution
    see: scenario and the console must display:
    "Error: 'FileName' is missing in 'mermaidconfig.json'. Please specify a valid 'FileName'."
    see: scenario

  • Missing OutputDirectory:
    If OutputDirectory is not provided, and no root OutputDirectory is provided,
    then the system must stop execution
    see: scenario
    and the console must display:
    "Error: 'OutputDirectory' is missing in 'mermaidconfig.json'. Please add the 'OutputDirectory'."
    see: scenario

  • Resolve OutputDirectory priority:
    Must resolve OutputDirectory by prioritizing PhysicalProject

    • Use PhysicalProject specific value if present
    • Fall back to root-level value if not present

    see: scenario

  • Permission denied:
    If the system does not have permission to write mermaidconfig.json in {cwd}:
    The system must abort
    see: scenario and the system must display:
    "Error: Cannot write to '{cwd}/mermaidconfig.json' â€” permission denied."
    and must exit with code 2
    (see: scenario A3)

  • General I/O error:
    If a general I/O error occurs (file is locked, disk error):
    The system must display:
    "Error: Failed to write file at '{cwd}/mermaidconfig.json': {message}"
    and must exit with code 3
    (see: scenario A4)
